# Draft:Dbvisit Software

Dbvisit Software (also referred to as Dbvisit) is a New Zealand software firm specializing in database disaster recovery, standby replication, and high-availability solutions. Its flagship product, StandbyMP, enables organizations to implement automated log shipping, failover, and monitoring for Oracle Standard Edition, Microsoft SQL Server, and PostgreSQL environments—functionality often reserved for enterprise database editions. Dbvisit is used globally in retail, utility, public sector, and other sectors. In June 2024, it was acquired by the Australian software consolidator [https://www.softwarecombined.com/ Software Combined Group].
History
Dbvisit was founded by Oracle Database Administrator(DBA) Arjen Visser in 2000 in Auckland, New Zealand.
The name "Dbvisit" is a composite of the founder's name and industry acronyms, as follows:
DBVISIT = DataBase Visser Information Technology
The company was established as a specialist provider of database disaster recovery and replication product targeted at Oracle Standard Edition customers.
In June 2024, Dbvisit Software was acquired by Australian software aggregator Software Combined Group. Industry press and the acquirer reported the transaction and noted that Dbvisit would retain its Auckland base.
Products and technology
Dbvisit’s principal product family is marketed as Dbvisit Standby and StandbyMP (Standby MultiPlatform). The software automates creation and maintenance of standby/replica databases by shipping and applying database logs, managing failover and switchover procedures, and providing monitoring and reporting for recovery-oriented operations.
StandbyMP extends capability across multiple database engines Oracle SE, Microsoft SQL Server and more recently PostgreSQL.
Third-party product listings and review pages summarize core features such as automated failover, centralized management, on-premises and cloud deployment support, and vendor-published RPO/RTO claims. Pricing and licensing notes are available on software marketplaces and product profiles. [https://www.g2.com/products/dbvisit-standby/pricing]
Independent coverage, reviews, and user feedback
* Industry press & news: The Software Combined acquisition of Dbvisit was reported by multiple outlets and local IT news sites, which covered the acquisition and commented on Dbvisit’s market niche (standby DR for Oracle SE and other databases).[https://pitchbook.com/profiles/company/139064-05]
* Technical reviews: ASPICON, a German database consultancy, conducted a hands-on review of StandbyMP v11 (coverage republished on Dbvisit’s site) and assessed its multi-platform capabilities and usability for SQL Server and Oracle scenarios. Dbvisit. DEEP, a European IT consultancy discusses disaster recovery planning and its importance when there is a critical event and reviews StandbyMP as a solution.
* User reviews / software marketplaces: Dbvisit Standby has profiles and user reviews on [https://www.g2.com/products/dbvisit-standby/reviews G2], [https://www.capterra.com/p/79609/Dbvisit-Standby/ Capterra], and similar marketplaces. Reviews frequently praise the product for simplifying DR tasks and responsive vendor support; some reviews note setup complexity for large or complex topologies. Pricing ranges and plans are summarized on marketplace pages but often require direct vendor contact for enterprise quotes.
* Press on PostgreSQL strategy: Dbvisit announced partnerships and activity to expand PostgreSQL support; coverage of a November 2024 partnership with CYBERTEC was reported in industry press and community news.
Customers and case studies
Dbvisit publishes customer case studies (for example, retail and utilities customers) that illustrate real-world deployments of Standby for disaster recovery and failover use cases. Some case studies have also been mirrored or archived on third-party sites. These case studies are vendor-provided material and serve as practical examples of product usage.[https://medium.com/@datapatrolt/case-study-automating-the-activation-of-standby-database-in-read-write-mode-for-testing-and-report-d265b1e88e42]
Market position and competition
Dbvisit occupies a niche [https://www.g2.com/categories/disaster-recovery market]: organizations that need standby/DR functionality for Oracle Standard Edition Database licensing instead of Enterprise Edition features (such as Oracle Data Guard). In vendor comparisons and community discussions, Dbvisit is mentioned as a cost-effective alternative in certain scenarios. Competitive alternatives listed on review sites include backup/replication and continuity platforms from larger vendors and open-source streaming replication solutions.
